name: Newport Beach Marriott Hotel & Spa

reviews.text: Having read the reviews, I wasn't particularly looking forward to our stay; but since that's where the meeting was ...
reviews.title: +- features, but great shower!

reviews.text: - Exterior is plain but the lobby/conference area is decent in an understated west coast style.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: - Front staff are probably the best I've seen in a while -- incredibly prompt, no wait at all, and incredibly friendly/helpful.
reviews.title: Great place-better on the inside

reviews.text: - We had a king room that was adequate in size and overlooked a pool, although both room & bathroom were smaller than what we had in NYC! I'm not convinced that the upgrade $$ for ocean view is necessary -- even on a clear day you don't get a great view, since it's quite a ways off. The bed was surprisingly comfortable (and I'm a stickler!) but their towels had seen better days. The shower was simply heavenly, one of the best ever!!! I didn't notice a problem with water pressure from the sink -- perhaps that's an issue unique to the towers (old infrastructure).
reviews.title: Not on the beach but great location if you have a car

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Appreciated being in the low-level complex rather than the tower -- no elevators to wait for!
reviews.title: lacking for a marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We popped in for a night without a reservation, because we were meeting friends in the area. They had an available "Ocean view" room, and we were quickly accommodated. The room was beautiful, the bed was super comfortable, the view was nice but since it's not really a beach resort the ocean view is pretty far away, beyond the golf course.
reviews.title: Expected more...

reviews.text: My stay was comfortable but for the 240$ a night I expected at least internet, parking, or breakfast for free. I was getting all those things free at the cheap motels I stayed at. We paid an extra 28 $ for parking, 13$ for internet, we didn't even bother with breakfast.
reviews.title: Stopped in for a night on a business trip

reviews.text: The hotel is walking distance to Fashion Island shopping mall, a nice place to spend time and money :)
reviews.title: Nice renovation of Marriott

reviews.text: Great place to spend a night if you are just passing through or in town for business. Everyone is very nice and attentive and the area couldn't be better. Shopping and dining across the street and the ocean is only a few driving blocks away.
reviews.title: Great Hotel if you pay the right rate

reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott for a business conference. It is obviously an older property , and although this is by no means a luxury hotel, I did find it to be very comfortable and had few complaints during our stay.
reviews.title: Expensive but feels it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights at the Marriott in Newport Beach using travel points. With this in mind, we were expecting much, but were placed in a 7th floor room with nice views of the golf course and Upper Newport Bay. We were the room closest to both the elevator and ice machine, so it was quite noisy. The air conditioner also made a lot of noise, including a "thunk" every time it shut off. If we were going to be staying longer than two night, I probably would have asked for a room change, but it was fine for what it was.
reviews.title: Central location, noisy room

reviews.text: The grounds of the hotel are very nice. It's located close to the PCH, so you can quickly drive to a number of beaches and places to eat. Like others have said, it's also across from Fashion Island, which has restaurants and shopping.
reviews.title: Beautiful inside and out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was pretty good sized, the bed was comfy and Marriott uses Bath & Body Works Orange Ginger bath products, which are my favorite! All in all, a fine place to stay.
reviews.title: Not as nice as I expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed during the long holiday weekend and enjoyed a great view and luxurious accommodations. Highly recommend this hotel. Close to shopping at Fashion Island (across the street) and short drives to nearby beaches and night life.
reviews.title: Honeymoon stay.... GREAT STAY!

reviews.text: Stayed here in May 2012. The room was small and the ocean view was hardly an ocean view. The ice machine on the floor didn't work and it just didn not meet my expectations. The lobby and entrance was beautiful. The shower had a dusty vent and the bedroom walls were thin. It wasn't awful, but it wasn't one of my best Marriott experiences.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - great service.

reviews.text: We liked the hotel ... Staff are helpful and hotel has coin layndry facility. What we didnt like - no free wifi in room and no free parking
reviews.title: Nice hotel, clean rooms, Starbucks on site

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked into this hotel on a Friday afternoon. We were given an upgrade to concierge level. The room was a little small and had no bathtub. It only had a large shower. The room overlooked a golf course. The bed was a King size bed and it was very comfortable with soft sheets. I did get a good night's sleep because of how comfortable the bed was. The hotel itself was a little crowded with business travelers. The staff was very nice but I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you like peace and quiet. We did enjoy happy hour at the bar downstairs but it was also packed with people. It was very loud and hard to talk unless you yelled. Parking was expensive, I believe it was $22.00 dollars to self park. We are gold members so we didn't have to pay for wireless internet but if you don't have status with Marriott they charge you for that too. I just think this hotel was a little too expensive for the room that I received. I also think if you self park, you shouldn't have to pay for it. It is within walking distance to the mall but you have to drive to Balboa Island. I would choose another hotel next time I am in the area.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed there Friday and Saturday night, night before our wedding and wedding night. We had a large group (15 rooms) and had a great time. The hotel staff was very attentive to everything that was going on. The poolside bar was great for all of the adults and children. Speaking of the kids, There were a lot of outside activities to keep them entertained. I would recommend this hotel, the biggest downfall was the price of parking ($28 a night for valet and $21 a night for self park)
reviews.title: great place

reviews.text: I was really, really surprised how dated the rooms were considering the ZIP code of this hotel.
reviews.title: Very Dated - Friendly Staff

reviews.text: The staff was exceptionally welcoming and friendly! The Starbucks lady was very helpful and we liked having the Starbucks on-site.
reviews.title: Rooms were very nice, Staff extrememly friendly. SUPER close to shopping.

aka: Newport Beach Marriott Hotel And Spa
description: Amid the unparalleled beauty and relaxed luxury of Newport Beach comes an inventive new concept in hospitality - and a whole new take on the Southern California lifestyle. Welcome to the $75 million redesign of the Newport Beach Marriott Hotel and Spa, where you'll find your most ambitious visions realized.
